Present location: INSTITUT DE PAPYROLOGIE ET D'ÉGYPTOLOGIE, UNIVERSITÉ DE LILLE III [02/049] LILLE
Name: Amulet (baboon)
Description: Found in a robbed Middle Kerma burial, this amulet has all the characteristics typical of a Egyptian manufacture and confirms contacts and exchanges between the two states.  Although very crude, the features of a seated baboon, one of the representations of the god Thoth, are clearly identifiable.
